oai_dc:dc.dc:title: "The Admiration of the Entire Country" message from the President with enhanced Civilian Conservation Corps insignia
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: While TSLA houses an item, it does not necessarily hold the copyright on the item, nor may it be able to determine if the item is still protected under current copyright law. oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Insignia; Emblems; Seals (insignia)
Civilian Conservation Corps (U.S.); New Deal, 1933-1939; Roosevelt, Franklin D. (Franklin Delano), 1882-1945
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: President Franklin D. Roosevelt's message to the nation concerning the Civilian Conservation Corps in 1936 is reproduced in the 1937 Civilian Conservation Corps Yearbook with the Civilian Conservation Corps insignia at the bottom of the page, enhanced with the specifications of Civilian Conservation Corps Camp Cordell Hull in red and green marker.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Roosevelt, Franklin D. (Franklin Delano), 1882-1945
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Civilian Conservation Corps in Tennessee Collection, 1933-1942
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This volume of the "Official Annual of the Civilian Conservation Corps, 'C' District CCC, Fourth Area, 1937" was donated by James O. Rickman of Johnson City, Tennessee. Rickman was with Camp Cordell Hull, Co. 1455, F-5 in the Unaka Range; of the Cherokee National Forest, and it is assumed that he enhanced the Civilian Conservation Corps insignia on this introductory page with the specifications of his camp.
